titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the "Digitization for Cultural Heritage Professionals" Workshop materials, 2000 UA 262

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center and requires 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-02 13:02:55 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: "Digitization for Cultural Heritage Professionals" Workshop materials
did.abstract: Brochures, lectures, seminars, and reading materials for a workshop hosted by Fondren Library on the skills, princriples, and best practice in the digitization of primary textual and image resources.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In March 2000 Fondren Library at Rice University hosted a five day workshop on digitization for cultural heritage professionals. The course focused on the skills, princriples, and best practice in the digitization of primary textual and image resources. The workshop was sponsored by the Humanities Advanced Technology and Information Institute (HATII).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains brochures, lectures, seminars, and reading materials for the workshop.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.
Stored off-site at the Library Service Center and requires 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: These materials were transferred to the Archives in 2000 from Lisa Spiro and Chuck Bearden, organizers and teachers in workshop.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: "Digitization for Cultural Heritage Professionals" Workshop materials, 2000, UA 262, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also UA 361 Rice University Information Files.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the "Digitization for Cultural Heritage Professionals" Workshop materials must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.

did.unittitle: Folder I: Lectures, Seminars, and Practicals
